item.title: Report X-2023090939
item.description:
Report X-2023090939

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: VINEYARD
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found sideways in the belly of a trailer. Upon discovery, the package was immediately contained in a hazmat labeled tote. DescribePack: One jug of Nano-strip was found to have a loose closure, however it was a slower leak. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a hazmat labeled tote. Clean-up was then conducted by QA to prepare the trailer to continue to be unloaded.

item.title: Report E-2023100337
item.description:
Report E-2023100337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: WEST VALLEY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 29, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1224 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the impacted site. Prior to their arrival, R+L personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas to contain the release. Crews utilized an 85-gallon overpack to contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. ER personnel worked in the previously deployed granular absorbents with hand tools. Crews then collected the previously deployed granular absorbents. All UN1224- impacted material was collected and containerized in the previously mentioned 85-gallon overpack for disposal.
